question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for display purposes. Create a text-based character homepage attribute panel for a character named Xiāo Kè.

checklist.title: Is the basic character attribute panel structure properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the code implements the fundamental structure of a character attribute panel including name display (Xiāo Kè), basic attributes (e.g., strength, agility, intelligence), health/mana indicators, and level information. Score 0 if there is no clear panel structure, 5 if only basic name and limited attributes are shown, and 10 if a complete and well-organized attribute panel is implemented.

checklist.title: Is the text-based visualization properly executed?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code effectively utilizes text characters (ASCII art, Unicode symbols, or other text elements) to create visual appeal without relying on images. Check for proper alignment, consistent spacing, and meaningful use of symbols to represent different attributes. Deduct 5 points if alignment is inconsistent, 3 points if spacing issues exist, and 5 points if the visualization is barely readable.

checklist.title: Is the character name 'Xiāo Kè' correctly displayed with proper formatting?
checklist.description: Verify if the character name 'Xiāo Kè' is properly displayed with the correct diacritical marks and appropriate prominence in the panel. Check if the name is styled to stand out from other elements and whether proper character encoding is used for the special characters. Deduct 5 points if diacritical marks are missing or incorrect, 3 points if the name doesn't stand out visually.

checklist.title: Does the implementation include interactive elements for the attribute panel?
checklist.description: Check if the code includes interactive features like hovering for additional information, expanding/collapsing attribute sections, ability to edit/update attributes, or keyboard navigation through the panel. Score 0 if no interaction is implemented, 5 if minimal interactions exist, and 10 if comprehensive interactive features are included.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing data, wrong input types, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. ASCII art animations 2. Dynamic attribute changes based on time/actions 3. Terminal-like effects or typewriter animations). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar display functions 2. Feature modules unrelated to character attributes 3. Fancy effects that affect readability or performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating data/view/controller layers), code organization, and maintainability. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the naming conventions are inconsistent or unclear. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the text-based design follows clear visual principles: 1) Consistent character usage for borders and separators 2) Logical grouping of related attributes 3) Proper use of whitespace and alignment principles. Deduct 3 points for inconsistent character usage, 5 points for illogical attribute grouping, and 5 points for poor spacing that affects readability. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects (if any) conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Immediate feedback for user interactions 2) Appropriate animation timing for text effects (150-300ms) 3) Clear focus states and navigation cues. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for overly long animations that delay information display, and 5 points for confusing navigation. The full score is 10 points.
